bullet_points: Review the course description, target audience, and objectives.
List the essential competencies and practical skills required for a "ChatGPT Pro Power User" in no-code productivity and analysis.
Identify the main tools and features participants must master.
Note any potential challenges or gaps in the current course idea that might affect the development of competencies.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Analyze the course idea to identify core competencies and skills participants should develop.

bullet_points: Specify what participants should know or be able to do before starting the course.
List any required accounts, technical setup, or prior experience.
Clearly highlight technical prerequisites (e.g., system requirements, account features).
Note fallback options if certain features (e.g., Custom GPT Builder) are unavailable.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Determine prerequisites and foundational knowledge required for participants.

bullet_points: Outline a sequence of modules that build upon each other.
Ensure coverage of all major tools and features as described in the course idea (e.g., ADA, Browse, Vision, etc.).
Briefly describe the focus of each module.
Briefly mention the expected progression in complexity from foundational to advanced.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Propose 8-10 main modules that logically progress from foundational to advanced topics.

bullet_points: For each module, provide a concise description of what the session covers.
List key takeaways—what participants will leave with.
Write specific learning goals using action verbs (e.g., "Participants apply...").
Name the tools and features covered in each module.
Estimate exercise duration for hands-on modules.
Highlight how each module’s activities contribute to the overall learning outcomes.
Incorporate assessment checkpoints (e.g., quick artifact-based reviews) where appropriate.
sub_tasks.sub_task: For each module, write a description, key takeaways, and specific learning goals.

bullet_points: Compile all module descriptions, learning goals, and takeaways into a clear, structured markdown outline.
Ensure the outline is comprehensive, logically ordered, and easy to follow.
Divide the markdown outline into clearly numbered sections with module titles, descriptions, learning goals (with actionable verbs), and takeaways.
Include a summary section for prerequisites and overall course objectives at the beginning for improved readability and coherence.
Do not include lesson content, slides, or exercise materials—focus strictly on structure and learning outcomes.
sub_tasks.sub_task: Write the full Course Outline in structured markdown format.
